snippet: Eni and Shell denied wrongdoing in their $1.1 billion acquisition of an oil block in 2011 from the Nigerian government.
abstract: Eni confirms that its recently appointed chief executive Claudio Descalzi and one of his key lieutenants are under investigation for international bribery over company's acquisition of offshore oil block in Nigeria; Eni and Royal Dutch Shell bought exploration track for $1.1 billion in 2011 after long and difficult negotiations.

byline.contributor: Elisabetta Povoledo contributed reporting from Rome.

lead_paragraph: Eni and Shell denied wrongdoing in their $1.1 billion acquisition of an oil block in 2011 from the Nigerian government.

headline.main: New Eni Chief Investigated Over Nigeria Purchase
headline.print_headline: New Eni Chief Investigated in Nigerian Oil Land Purchase
